𝗙𝗢𝗖𝗨𝗦-𝗔𝗡𝗖𝗛𝗢𝗥 | Anchoring focus while reading on websites.  

◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 📘 TypeScript 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Anchoring focus while reading on websites.
📅 Created: Apr 2025 • Updated: Jun 2025

◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Sentence-level focus
✅ Smart scrolling
✅ Multiple focus styles


◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐ 6 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 0 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 0 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

The focus-anchor repository provides a Chrome extension designed to improve readability and focus on web content. It allows users to highlight content at the sentence level with various styles and automatically scrolls to keep the focused sentence in view. This tool enhances productivity by minimizing distractions and promoting concentrated reading.

◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈◈

🔗 𝗟𝗜𝗡𝗞𝗦
• 𝗚𝗶𝘁𝗛𝘂𝗯: https://github.com/hamsteak1488/focus-anchor

𝗥𝗘𝗔𝗦𝗢𝗡𝗔𝗕𝗟𝗘 | Automatically rewrite clickbait tweets into reasonable ones.  

❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Automatically rewrite clickbait tweets into reasonable ones.
📅 Created: Jun 2025 • Updated: Jun 2025

❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Detects clickbait tweets
✅ Replaces clickbait tweets with reasonable alternatives using the OpenAI API
✅ Provides a toggle to show the original tweet
✅ Uses OpenAI API for tweet rewriting
✅ Configuration via Chrome extension popup


❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

🍴 0 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 0 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

The 'reasonable' Chrome extension detects clickbait tweets on Twitter (X.com) and replaces them with more reasonable alternatives using the OpenAI API. Users can toggle between the original and rewritten tweets. The extension is configured via a popup where users can enter their OpenAI API key.

❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂❂

𝗔𝗦𝗖𝗜𝗜-𝗠𝗢𝗩𝗜𝗘 | Streaming the ASCII version of Star Wars to command-line clients via SSH or Telnet.  🔥 Super Hot!

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🐹 Go 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Streaming the ASCII version of Star Wars to command-line clients via SSH or Telnet.
📅 Created: Sep 2022 • Updated: Jun 2025

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Streams Star Wars ASCII movie
✅ SSH and Telnet server
✅ Interactive TUI with keyboard and mouse support
✅ Docker support


♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐ 407 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 26 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 3 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

The ascii-movie repository provides a Go-based implementation of an SSH and Telnet server that streams the original Star Wars movie in ASCII format. It features an interactive terminal user interface and can be easily deployed using Docker. Inspired by asciimation and blinkenlights, this project offers a nostalgic command-line entertainment experience.

♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦♦

𝗞𝗔𝗜𝗧𝗔𝗜_𝗦𝗧𝗥𝗨𝗖𝗧 | Describing and parsing binary data formats (file formats, network packets, etc.) in a declarative way, generating code for multiple programming languages.  🔥 Super Hot!

▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 💻 Shell 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Describing and parsing binary data formats (file formats, network packets, etc.) in a declarative way, generating code for multiple programming languages.
📅 Created: Feb 2016 • Updated: Jun 2025

▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Declarative language for describing binary data structures.
✅ Compiler (`ksc`) to generate parsers in multiple languages (C++, C#, Go, Java, JavaScript, Lua, Nim, Perl, PHP, Python, Ruby).
✅ Cross-language and cross-platform support.
✅ Growing collection of format descriptions in the `kaitai_struct_formats` repository.


▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐⭐ 4.2K 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 199 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 498 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Kaitai Struct is a declarative language and toolchain for describing binary data structures. It allows developers to define a format once and then compile it into parsers for various programming languages, simplifying the process of reading and interpreting binary data from files or network streams. The project also includes a repository of pre-defined format descriptions.

▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪▪

𝗔𝗡𝗬𝗤𝗨𝗘𝗥𝗬 | Querying diverse data sources with SQL and enabling LLMs to access and utilize this data.  🔥 Super Hot!

◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🐹 Go 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Querying diverse data sources with SQL and enabling LLMs to access and utilize this data.
📅 Created: Apr 2024 • Updated: Jun 2025

◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ SQL query engine for various data sources (files, databases, apps)
✅ Integration with LLMs (ChatGPT, Claude) via Model Context Protocol (MCP)
✅ Acts as a MySQL server for connecting with MySQL-compatible clients
✅ Extensible via plugins


◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐ 956 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 50 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 7 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

Anyquery is a SQL query engine that allows users to run SQL queries on various data sources, including files, databases, and applications. It integrates with LLMs like ChatGPT and Claude using the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling them to access and utilize the queried data. Additionally, Anyquery can act as a MySQL server, allowing users to connect with their favorite MySQL-compatible clients.

◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦◦

🔗 𝗟𝗜𝗡𝗞𝗦
• 𝗚𝗶𝘁𝗛𝘂𝗯: https://github.com/julien040/anyquery

𝗪𝗔𝗟-𝗟𝗜𝗦𝗧𝗘𝗡𝗘𝗥 | Implementing Event-Driven Architecture by capturing PostgreSQL database changes and publishing them to message brokers for downstream services.  🌟 Rising Fast!

┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅

𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗞: 🐹 Go 
🎯 𝗨𝗦𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗦𝗘: Implementing Event-Driven Architecture by capturing PostgreSQL database changes and publishing them to message brokers for downstream services.
📅 Created: Jan 2020 • Updated: Jun 2025

┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅

✨ 𝗞𝗘𝗬 𝗙𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗘𝗦 ✨

✅ Listens to PostgreSQL WAL (Write-Ahead Log) for data changes.
✅ Uses logical decoding (pgoutput) to convert WAL changes into a logical replication protocol.
✅ Publishes data change events to message brokers (NATS JetStream, Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ, Google Pub/Sub).
✅ Provides filtering capabilities to process specific table events (insert, update).
✅ Supports topic mapping for custom routing of events.
✅ Offers at-least-once message delivery guarantee.


┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅

📊 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗧𝗦

⭐⭐⭐ 403 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀
🍴 50 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗸𝘀
🔍 8 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝗶𝘀𝘀𝘂𝗲𝘀

┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅

📝 𝗔𝗕𝗢𝗨𝗧 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗝𝗘𝗖𝗧

The WAL-Listener service captures changes in a PostgreSQL database using logical decoding and publishes them as events to various message brokers like NATS, Kafka, RabbitMQ, and Google Pub/Sub. It supports filtering events based on tables and actions, and allows topic mapping for custom routing. This enables the implementation of Event-Driven Architecture with transactional messaging to maintain data consistency across microservices.

┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅┅

🔗 𝗟𝗜𝗡𝗞𝗦
• 𝗚𝗶𝘁𝗛𝘂𝗯: https://github.com/ihippik/wal-listener
